intro: Microlicia mucorifera, commonly known as the Malayan microlicia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and shrublands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
